Class Perceptron

  • java.lang.Object
    • Perceptron
  • public class Perceptron
extends java.lang.Object
    The Perceptron class implements a feed-forward neural network with a configurable number of input nodes, output nodes, number of hidden layers, and number of nodes in each hidden layer. A Perceptron object can read inputs and weights from a file and run the network. Methods: public Perceptron(int inputNodes, int[] hiddenLayerNodes, int outputNodes) private static int arrayMax(int[] arr) private void readWeights(String filename) private double[] runNetwork(double[] inputs) private void resetActivations() private void readInputs(String filename) private static double activationFunction(double x) public static void main(String[] args)
    Version:
    9/4/2019 (creation date)
    Author:
    Russell Yang

    • Constructor Detail

      • Perceptron

        public Perceptron​(int inputNodes,
                  int[] hiddenLayerNodes,
                  int outputNodes)
        Constructor for the Perceptron class. Sets instance variables to values based on the parameters.
        Parameters:
        inputNodes - the number of nodes that the network uses to take in inputs
        hiddenLayerNodes - an array where each element is the number of nodes in a hidden layer of the network, and the length of the array is the number of hidden layers
        outputNodes - the number of output nodes in the network

        The main method is used to instantiate a Perceptron object, read weights, read inputs (and run the network).
        Parameters:
        args - the supplied command-line arguments
